frontend/src/pages/ApiDocs.tsx: Renders a documentation page for the VAT Calculation API, showing endpoint details, request/response parameters, and code examples for OSS and reverse charge scenarios.
frontend/src/pages/Invoice.tsx: Invoice generation page that collects seller/buyer details and line items, computes VAT per line using country rules, and supports exporting the invoice as PDF or XML.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Renders the Glotaxa marketing landing page with a hero section, feature grid (multi-country VAT, compliant invoices, PDF export, etc.), and a 'Get Started' button that triggers the app entry point.
frontend/src/pages/RegionSelect.tsx: Displays a country selection UI split into EU member states and UK, allowing the user to pick a country for VAT calculation.
frontend/src/pages/Transaction.tsx: Main transaction form page where users configure supplier/buyer countries, buyer type, VAT category, net amount, and line items; computes VAT in real-time and shows compliance score and risk warnings.
frontend/src/types/invoice.ts: Defines TypeScript interfaces for an EN 16931-compliant invoice, including header, seller/buyer details, line items, payment terms, and the top-level Invoice16931 structure.
frontend/src/utils/complianceScoreCalcul: Calculates a 0â€“100 compliance score for a transaction by deducting points for missing VAT ID, invoice number, category, or reverse-charge note on cross-border deals.
frontend/src/utils/invoicePDF.ts: Generates a styled HTML invoice document from an Invoice16931 object and triggers a browser print/download as a PDF.
frontend/src/utils/invoiceXML.ts: Serializes an Invoice16931 object into a UBL 2.x XML string conforming to the EN 16931 e-invoicing standard.
frontend/src/utils/riskDetector.ts: Detects VAT compliance risks such as potential OSS registration requirements for cross-border B2C sales or reduced-rate eligibility checks, returning an array of warning strings.
frontend/src/utils/vatLogicExplainer.ts: Generates a human-readable, multi-section text explanation of a VAT decision given transaction inputs (seller/buyer country, buyer type, category, rate, VAT type, OSS status, compliance score, and risks).
